籤詩版本二:
A mixture of fish and dragon means the same thing
Hold on to the deep pool and wait for luck
Unconsciously, my head popped out
Yumen jumped over the Dragon Palace
詩意: The hexagram fish and dragon remain unchanged. Everything comes in time.
解曰: Although it is Ziji. Also wait. Plan your own business. Don't act recklessly.
籤詩故事一:
◇Hongwu watching cattle
Zhu Yuanzhang, a native of Zhongli, Haozhou (now Fengyang County, Anhui Province), was born in the first year of Tianli of Yuan Wenzong of the Yuan Dynasty, ranking fourth in his family. He was born in a poor peasant family. Due to poverty when he was young, he was unable to study and once herded cattle for the landlord.
In the fourth year of Zhizheng (1344), there was a severe drought in Huaibei. Zhu Yuanzhang's father, mother, and brother died successively, so he had no choice but to become a novice monk in Huangjue Temple.
Less than two months after entering the temple, due to the difficulty in collecting the rent of the temple in the famine years, the temple owner closed the warehouse and dismissed the monks. Zhu Yuanzhang had to leave his hometown and become a wandering monk (a monk who made a living by begging).
Later, Zhu Yuanzhang became the Taizu of the Ming Dynasty and the "civilian emperor" in Chinese history, with the reign name "Hongwu".
(The metaphor of this story is that being ordinary for a while does not mean that it will be the same in the future. This is because the time has not yet come.)
聖意:
The house is safe.
